command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $domain='example.com'; $out='C:\ProgramData\recon\censys_search_example.com.json'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path C:\ProgramData\recon | Out-Null; $log='C:\ProgramData\recon\recon.log'; try { $token=$env:CENSYS_API_TOKEN; if([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($token)){ throw 'CENSYS_API_TOKEN not set'; } $headers=@{ 'Authorization'="Bearer $token"; 'Accept'='application/json'; 'Content-Type'='application/json' }; $body=@{ q="services.tls.certificates.leaf_data.subject.common_name: $domain OR hostnames: $domain"; per_page=50 } | ConvertTo-Json; $uri='https://search.censys.io/api/v2/hosts/search'; $resp=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $uri -Headers $headers -Method Post -Body $body -UseBasicParsing -TimeoutSec 45 -ErrorAction Stop; if(($resp.StatusCode -ge 200) -and ($resp.StatusCode -lt 300) -and ($resp.Headers['Content-Type'] -match 'application/json')){ ($resp.Content | ConvertFrom-Json) | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6 | Set-Content -Path $out -Encoding UTF8 } else { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) Censys non-success or non-JSON for $domain. Status=$($resp.StatusCode)" } } catch { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) Censys error for $domain: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Performs an authenticated search against the paid Censys API for hosts and certificates related to the domain, handling JSON securely.
rationale_steps: Use bearer token authentication to a closed-source research dataset.
Submit a focused query body to limit noise.
Ensure JSON content, parse, and save.
Error handling and logging avoid token disclosure.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper syntax, balanced quotes/braces, appropriate error handling, and valid parameter usage throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command directly implements T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by querying the paid Censys API service for domain intelligence, properly handling authentication, storing results securely, and logging errors appropriately.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed, using correct syntax for variable assignment, control flow, cmdlet parameters, and JSON handling, with all quotes and parentheses balanced.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with the T1597 technique by performing an authenticated query against the paid Censys API to gather intelligence on a target domain, which is a classic example of searching closed sources.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced braces/quotes, valid cmdlets and parameters, proper error handling, and correct use of headers and JSON conversion.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It authenticates to the Censys API using a bearer token to query closed-source data about a domain and saves the JSON results, aligning with T1597’s use of paid/private data sources for reconnaissance.
